oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Lockplate from Conestoga Rifle Works
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Hammer and partial lockplate with engraved rooster design and "Conestoga Rifle Works" on it. Originally established in Lancaster (Pa.) by Henry Leman, one of a long line of distinguished German gunsmiths, Conestoga Rifle Works at the time of the Civil War was manufacturing rifled muskets for the Federal government in Philadelphia. Leman also made a large number of civilian rifles as well as those for the Indian trade.
